abstract: Federal prosecutors decide to return $100,000 seized from North Carolina convenience store owner Lyndon McLellan; Justice Department says it will end such seizures, form of civil asset forfeiture based on pattern of small cash deposits without criminal charge or evidence of crime.
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors agreed Wednesday to return more than $100,000 that was seized from a rural convenience store owner even though the owner, Lyndon McLellan, was not accused of a crime.

headline.main: North Carolina: More Seized Assets to Be Returned
headline.print_headline: North Carolina: More Seized Assets to Be Returned

snippet: Federal prosecutors agreed Wednesday to return more than $100,000 that was seized from a rural convenience store owner even though the owner, Lyndon McLellan, was not accused of a crime.
